interfaceGroups: LST analysis with SSI - Hollyhurst Farm
LST analysis with DNI - Hollyhurst Farm
LST analysis with SSI - ESA ESRIN

layout.interfaceGroup: Basemaps

meta.description: Open Street Map base layer

A suitability map that categorizes Kent into different suitability levels based on their suitability for developing a solar farm: ‘Not Suitable,’ ‘Least Suitable,’ ‘Moderately Suitable,’ and ‘Most Suitable’.

layout.interfaceGroup: Final Suitability Map - Kent

meta.description: A map that scores areas in Kent on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable) according to their potential for solar farm development.

layout.interfaceGroup: Final Suitability Map - Kent

meta.description: The presence of historically important areas and their respective 100 m buffer were classified as unsuitable areas. The historically important areas used in this study were obtained from the Open Data Hub of English Heritage.  Four key categories of historical sites were considered: Scheduled Monuments, Wreck Sites, World Heritage, and Registered Battlefields.

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

meta.description: The presence of wildlife designations and their respective 100 m buffer were classified as unsuitable areas. The wildlife designations used in this study were obtained from the Natural England Open Data Geoportal. Five key categories of wildlife designations were considered: Special Areas of Conservation (SAC), Special Protection Areas (SPA), Ramsar Sites, Sites of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI), and Local Nature Reserves (LNRs).

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

meta.description: Agricultural land classification dataset from Natiural England consists of six nationally recognised grades of land; grade 1 was classified as unsuitable due to their high arable value.

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

meta.description: The following land use classes and their respective 100 m buffer were classified as unsuitable areas: continuous and discontinuous urban fabric, industrial or commercial units, road and rail networks and associated land, port areas, airports, mineral extraction sites, dump sites, construction sites, green urban areas, sport and leisure facilities, water bodies, and estuaries.

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

sources.name: C5 - Slope: How steep or flat the land is

meta.description: The slope data was categorized to mark any gradients over 14% as unsuitable, as they would be too steep for development.

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

sources.name: C6 - Aspect: The direction the land faces (e.g., north, south)

meta.description: Slopes facing southeast to southwest, as well as any aspects with a slope of less than 5%, were classified as suitable. All other cases were considered unsuitable.

layout.interfaceGroup: Binary Constraint Layers - Kent

meta.description: The higher the Direct Normalized Solar Irradiation (DNI), the more suitable the location for solar farm development - on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable)

attribution.text: Surface Radiation Data Set - Heliosat (SARAH) from EUMESTAT

layout.interfaceGroup: Factor Layers - Kent

meta.description: The higher the Solar Surface Irradiance (SIS), the more suitable the location for solar farm development - on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable)

attribution.text: Surface Radiation Data Set - Heliosat (SARAH) from EUMESTAT

layout.interfaceGroup: Factor Layers - Kent

sources.name: F2 - Distance from historically important areas

meta.description: The greater the distance from historically important areas, the more suitable the location for solar farm development - on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable)

layout.interfaceGroup: Factor Layers - Kent

meta.description: The greater the distance from wildlife designations, the more suitable the location for solar farm development - on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable)

layout.interfaceGroup: Factor Layers - Kent

meta.description: The greater the distance from built-up areas, the more suitable the location for solar farm development  - on a scale from 0 (least suitable) to 1 (most suitable)

layout.interfaceGroup: Factor Layers - Kent

meta.description: Analysis of Land Surface Temperature (LST) with correlation to Surface Solar Irradiation (SSI) above threshold of 50 W/m² in January over targeting a new solar farm which is planned for development at Hollyhurst Farm in Warwickshire County, England.
